Reviews.Title: Powerful and Attractive Package in a Very Competitive Price Point
Reviews.Author: Meengla
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Amazon to take as gift to an overseas relative in Asia. I have spent a little time with this--totaling about 10-11 hours of use. I am liking this laptop so far: It is fast, very nice looking, and light-enough in weight to not tax your lap too much for 2-3 hours.But, somehow, I thought I was getting a 3 lbs ultrabook which would not have a DVD drive. This one does and it's heavier than 3 lbs but not too heavy.The keyboard is perhaps the least pleasing hardware: It seems a bit jumpy: The keys are a bit noisy to press and seem to make some spring like sound--not very overt but I have seen better keyboards in even cheaper laptops.Also, I have seen better trackpads than this one but this is adequate.The mouse clicks on the trackpad are also a bit noisy and harder than some other laptops I have owned/used.Windows 8 is no longer an acquired taste to me but this is my first non-touch Windows 8 device (I own an Acer Iconia W510) and I think I'd prefer this one to have touch screen--perhaps I am spoiled.I have played some 1080p and 720p videos and they played fine.But the price was 'right' and this can do a lot of very productive work. I am giving it 5 stars. You won't regret buying this as a laptop. My preference would be to get a 'convertible' tablet/laptop instead--perhaps something like Dell Venue 11 Pro or some other convertible running Windows 8 with at least Atom Baytrail or Core i3 or better.I may add to this Review later.

Reviews.Title: I am very satisfied with a high quality product with great features for less money,this is my second ASUS Laptop
Reviews.Author: RW
Reviews.Content: I chose this laptop for the i5 processor and the awesome performance, it has all the bells and whistles like the top name laptops for a lot less money. My daughter tells me that windows 8 is working great.

Reviews.Title: not so happy
Reviews.Author: Dennel Ann Ballard
Reviews.Content: Wont hold a charge, seems to be a reconditioned unit? Feel like not all info was given about msy have been used?

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: PAPA7951
Reviews.Content: This product was scheduled to arrive on Jan. 17 but showed up on the 14th, which was very appreciated. Neatly packed and all instructions. Booted up with no problem. I was looking at the i7 but it turns out the i5 was perfect.

Reviews.Title: worthless
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this laptop, I really did. In reality, it's nothing more than a $600 paperweight. I bought this laptop to browse the web but this is exactly what I cannot do with it. It simply does not stay connected to the internet for more than half an hour at a time. Forget about streaming videos or having long Skype sessions. I live in the city, which means there are dozens of wi-fi networks around me even if my own doesn't work for some reason. Yet, every half hour it just stops working and informs me that there are no wireless networks available. I've spent hours upon hours on the phone with Asus tech support. I've restored this thing to factory settings, I've downloaded countless updates, and it is still, to this day, just a $600 paperweight. Worst $600 I've ever spent. Do not repeat my mistakes!UPDATE:  Last night Asus finally admitted that this laptop is a lemon. They now want me to send it back to their service center for repairs. Of course they are not providing secure packaging, just shipping labels. If something happens to it in transit and it arrives damaged, it will void the warranty. The agent I spoke to was supposed to immediately email me return instructions and shipping labels. Nothing in my inbox after 12 hours. Today is Friday and I was going to deal with this on my lunch break but with no instructions and labels I will have to wait till next week. Words can't describe how disappointed and angry I am. Terrible workmanship plus terrible customer service equals the worst buying experience I've had in a long time. Stay away from Asus!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Aarons
Reviews.Content: Great laptop, windows 8 takes some getting used to. Beautiful display,  if you don't shut down some of the apps at start up, the computer will run slowly. But as soon as you cut back on the unnecessary apps it lightning fast.

Reviews.Title: The keyboard has latency isssues
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: But everything else is fine. The more I use it the better the keyboard response is. I think  maybe I need to just get use to this type of keyboard.

Reviews.Title: ASUS laptop weird flat keyboard
Reviews.Author: eastcastle007
Reviews.Content: This model, and many other models of ASUS laptop including my ASUS A53SD-TS73 Intel Core-i7, have weird keyboard design. 1) ALL THE KEYS are absolutely flat with EQUAL distance among keys; 2) the number pad on the right has non-standard layout without a much wider dividing gap to the main keyboard area at the left like that seen in all standard keyboards. These 2 usual features make the typing VERY DIFFICULT without looking at the keys because 1) the key pad has no contour by being flat among the same distanced keys, compounded by the lack of a wider gap to separate the number keypad. Therefore the entire keyboard is just like a woman's private part that is without recession, that is, no landmark. Before the purchase, a CNET.com reviewer pointed out this unusualality which unfortunately I did not treat seriously. On balance, the PC is powerful and fast loaded with features that are only available with much more expensive units. For this, it is highly satisfied product.

Reviews.Title: nice laptop
Reviews.Author: tones
Reviews.Content: this laptop is the freaking bomb its super fast and just so cool and slim and sleek and i dont mind windows 8 being on it
